# Preventive Maintenance and Repair of Generator Sets
## Background Information
Construction d Defence Canada (CDC) solicits proposals from interested parties for preventive maintenance and repair of generator sets at Montreal and St-Hubert Garrisons (Quebec). The proposed project aims to ensure the integrity and uninterrupted operation of emergency power systems.
### Estimated Cost and Timeframe
The estimated cost for this project is in the order of $345,000 for a two-year period, with possibility of three additional one-year extensions. The maximum possible value for this project is $810,000.
## Terms and Conditions
This solicitation is being conducted in accordance with the requirements of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Chapter Nineteen of the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).
### Security Requirements
The selected contractor will be required to hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).
### Questions and Documentation
Bidders should direct their questions solely to Aniss Hayder, the point of contact identified in this advertisement.  bidders who address their questions to anyone other than the point of contact may, for that reason alone, be disqualified.

Tender Documentation and Submission:
Tender documents and the proposal submission process are available on Merx. It is the responsibility of the bidder to ensure they comprehend and comply with all requirements.
## Important Dates

* Publication Date: 2023-12-06
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-01-18 14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2024-01-18

## Contact Information
For further information and clarification regarding this project, please contact:
* Name: Aniss Hayder
* Email: aniss.hayder@dcc-cdc.gc.ca
* Phone: 438-340-4303

## Financial Terms and Security Clearance
A valid Security Clearance is mandatory for the project. Please confirm you have reviewed the General Purchase Agreement published on the MERX system.

## Areas of Work 
* Inspection and maintenance of generators
* Allowance for additional work requests
* Majoration sur les matériaux (material mark-up)
